page.title: 15THE GRAND UNION CANAL
page.content: The Grand Union Canal stretches North to the Colne Valley. It passes next to the Village of Denham and Harefield Moor. Our stretch of the canal contained 1 lock and 1 bridge. The canal is surrounded by woodland and grassland. To the east of the canal is a golf course,also there is aquaduct where a stream passes under Denham Lock. The place to the south of the railway bridge is old Denham. There is a large mooring site in one of the flooded gravel pit that is linked to the canal.The Frays River runs on the east side of the dismantled railway . The River Colne flows along the west side of The Grand Union Canal. Fishes found in the canal are, Barbel, Bleak, Bullhead, Common Bream, Common carp, Chub, Dace, Freshwater Eel, Gudgeon,River Lamprey, Perch, Minnow, Roach,Pike,Rudd and Trout.
